intro: Mentzelia todiltoensis, commonly known as the Todilto morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry plains. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia todiltoensis is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
